title: 109_s762
content: The "Highway Funding Equity Act of 2005" may be cited as the Act. It includes a minimum guarantee provision. The "Highway Funding Equity Act of 2005" includes amendments to section 105 of title 23, United States Code, ensuring allocation of funds among states for various highway programs from 2005 to 2009. The "Highway Funding Equity Act of 2005" includes provisions for distributing funds among states for highway programs like congestion mitigation, air quality improvement, recreational trails, and Appalachian development highways. States must meet certain percentage requirements based on tax payments into the Highway Trust Fund. The "Highway Funding Equity Act of 2005" requires states to meet percentage requirements based on tax payments into the Highway Trust Fund, with exceptions for states with low population density. The Secretary will apportion funds exceeding $2,800,000,000 to each State equally for specified programs, based on a ratio of funds apportioned to the State for each program. The Secretary will apportion funds to each State for specified programs based on a ratio of funds apportioned for each program, with the remaining funds distributed according to section 104(b)(3). The Secretary will apportion funds to each State based on specified programs, with funds distributed according to section 104(b)(3). In fiscal years 2005 through 2009, funds will be authorized from the Highway Trust Fund for this purpose. Additionally, a guarantee of a 95 percent return will be ensured before making any apportionment under this title. The Secretary will adjust percentages in the table to ensure they total 100 percent if they exceed that amount. Adjustments can only be made if a State's percentage is at least 95 percent of the determined ratio. In subsection (e), percentages must not exceed 100 percent as per subsection (a)(2). Subsection (e) is amended to include subsections (a)(2)(B)(ii) and (d).
